lines.text: Harold, how long are you gonna keep driving around without knowing where we're going?
Barf, have you finished unscrambling those letters yet?

[finishes unscrambling letters]
Fagabeefe? Haha. Fagabeefe. Hey, Melio - fagabeefe.

[shouts]
*Shut up*!
See you at the finish line... wherever that may be.
Ha! It's easy!
Well, what is it?
It's like a lookout off a cliff or something.
It means Cherry Point.
How'd you get that?
Cherry Point.
What about the ball?
[Melio knocks the ball off the table]

[shouts]
You idiot!

[looking through telescope at a girl getting undressed in window]
If I'm lucky, I may get a view of Venus' two moons.

[pointing at the sky in the other direction]
Hey, Einstein - isn't Venus over there?

[loudly, to wake up Lucille]
No, Harold, there *aren't* any cookies left!
My brother doesn't know I exist, he didn't even remember my birthday.
When's your birthday?
Today.

[as Adam starts to drive off]
And I suppose it was too much of a bother to remember that today's your brother's birthday!
What does it mean, Harold?
How should I know? That's why my dad got me a computer!
